q: Larry Page speaking to the European Parliament, 2009. An "unexpected shakeup" went down at Google today. Larry Page, company co-founder, will take over as CEO effective April 4. Page, 37, is reclaiming the top job from Eric Schmidt , who had been brought in as CEO a decade ago because Google's investors believed the company needed a more mature leader, reports KTVU.
